modules.description: Provides functions to render shapes, handle user input, and animate graphical elements. Works with types such as colors, coordinates, and time intervals to build interactive visual content. Enables creation of educational visualizations and simple games by combining geometric primitives and event-driven logic.

Clamps integer values to the 0-255 range for color component normalization. Constructs color values from red, green, and blue components, and provides predefined color constants for common hues. Operates on an opaque color type representing RGB values.

Provides arithmetic operations for integers and floats, including custom range-based operators like (/..) and (+..), and standard mathematical functions such as rounding, modulus, and trigonometric conversions. Works with int, float, and generic numeric types. Used for numerical computations, angle conversions, and value normalization in mathematical or game-related logic.

Converts integer millisecond values to POSIX time floats and vice versa, enabling precise time coordinate transformations. Operates on integer millisecond counts and floating-point POSIX timestamps. Used to synchronize system time with external data sources requiring millisecond precision.

Handles key press and release events, mapping input to string representations. Processes key codes and modifiers to generate accurate character outputs. Used in game input handling and text editor command parsing.

This module offers purely functional set operations—such as membership checks, insertion, deletion, union, intersection, and difference—alongside traversal, partitioning, and element retrieval (min, max, arbitrary) for ordered elements stored in balanced binary trees. It enables efficient handling of dynamic unique element collections, sorted data processing, and seamless list-set conversions, leveraging logarithmic time complexity for core operations.

Creates and manipulates sets with insertion, removal, and empty set initialization. Operates on abstract set types that encapsulate unique elements. Used to manage dynamic collections where membership checks and modifications are required.
